metadata.feature_description: Shows most popular content across the community with view counts and engagement metrics

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View Popular Content section for different time periods

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics page loads with content type tabs
steps.actual: Community Analytics page loaded with tabs for Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki

steps.action: Click on date picker to view time period options
steps.expected: Time period dropdown shows Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom options
steps.actual: Dropdown displayed with all 5 time period options: Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom

steps.expected: Date range updates to show 1 month period and charts update accordingly
steps.actual: Date range changed to '28 Jan 2026 - 27 Feb 2026' and Comparative Term changed to '1 m'. Chart x-axis updated to show daily intervals

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View Popular Content section in empty state

steps.action: Scroll to Popular Content section in Community Analytics
steps.actual: Popular Content section displayed with heading 'Popular Content'

steps.expected: Appropriate message for no content available
steps.actual: Message displayed: 'No popular content available in selected period'

steps.action: Click on different content type tabs (Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki)
steps.expected: Each content type tab switches to show analytics for that type
steps.actual: All 6 content types (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) switch correctly. Each shows content-specific Community Health metrics

steps.action: Verify Wiki content type shows Wiki-specific metrics
steps.expected: Wiki section shows metrics specific to Wiki articles
steps.actual: Wiki section displayed with metrics: 'Articles older than 24 hours with no Views', 'Articles older than 12 hours with Views but no Interaction', 'Articles older than 24 hours deleted'
Comparative Term dropdown displayed with options: 1 y, 1 m, 1 w

steps.action: Change Comparative Term when time period changes
steps.expected: Comparative Term auto-adjusts based on selected time period
steps.actual: When Month period selected, Comparative Term automatically changed to '1 m'

steps.action: Click Export button in Community Analytics
steps.expected: Export triggers download of analytics data
steps.actual: Export button clicked and download triggered (file downloaded as .xlsx)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify view count and engagement metrics display

steps.expected: CREATES and VIEWS counters are displayed
steps.actual: CREATES: 0 and VIEWS: 0 displayed correctly with chart visualization

steps.expected: Engagement percentage and breakdown (Interacted, Formed Relationship, Shared) displayed
steps.actual: Engagement: 0% with breakdown showing Interacted: 0, Formed Relationship: 0, Shared: 0

steps.action: Check for pagination controls in Popular Content section
steps.expected: Pagination controls visible when content exists, or empty state message when no content
steps.actual: Empty state message displayed: 'No popular content available in selected period'. No pagination controls visible (expected behavior when no content exists)

steps.action: Verify content items would be clickable when available
steps.expected: Popular content items should be links to actual content when data exists
steps.actual: No popular content available to click through. Code review confirms GetPopularContent method retrieves content items with links. Empty state handling works correctly.

observations: The Popular Content section exists and functions correctly across all 6 content types (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki)
Time period selection (Day, Week, Month, Year, Custom) works correctly and updates the date range and chart accordingly
Comparative Term dropdown (1y, 1m, 1w) auto-adjusts based on selected time period
Empty state is handled gracefully with the message 'No popular content available in selected period'
Each content type has its own Community Health metrics specific to that content type (e.g., Wiki shows 'Articles' metrics, Answers shows 'Questions' metrics)
Export functionality successfully triggers download of .xlsx file

Pagination and click-through to content items could not be fully tested due to no popular content data existing in the test environment. Code review confirms these features are implemented via GetPopularContent method in AnalyticsDataController.cs
Content sorting by popularity could not be directly tested due to no content data, but the infrastructure exists in the GetPopularContent method which returns PopularContentItem objects
